programs.intro: We support Moroccan students through four distinct pathways to US higher education. Each pathway has specific requirements, timelines, and application processes.
programs.undergraduate_for_desc: High school graduates or current students seeking a 4-year Bachelor's degree at a US university.
programs.undergraduate_req1: High school diploma (Baccalauréat) with strong grades
programs.undergraduate_req2: English proficiency: TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT) or IELTS (minimum 6.5)
programs.undergraduate_req3: SAT or ACT scores (required by some universities)
programs.undergraduate_req4: Personal essays and letters of recommendation
programs.undergraduate_timeline2: Applications due: November-January for Fall admission
programs.graduate_for_desc: University graduates seeking Master's or PhD degrees in specialized fields.
programs.graduate_req1: Bachelor's degree (Licence or equivalent) with good academic standing
programs.graduate_req2: English proficiency: TOEFL (minimum 90-100 iBT) or IELTS (minimum 7.0)
programs.graduate_req3: GRE or GMAT scores (depending on program)
programs.graduate_req4: Statement of purpose and research interests
programs.graduate_timeline2: Applications due: December-February for Fall admission
programs.graduate_doc6: CV/Resume highlighting research and work experience
programs.graduate_doc7: Letters of recommendation from professors or employers (3)
programs.graduate_doc8: Writing samples or portfolio (for certain programs)
programs.community_for_desc: Students seeking affordable entry to US higher education with transfer options to 4-year universities.
programs.community_req2: English proficiency: TOEFL (minimum 60-70 iBT) or IELTS (minimum 5.5-6.0)
programs.community_req3: Lower cost alternative with transfer pathways
programs.community_timeline3: Can transfer to 4-year university after 2 years
programs.esl_for_desc: Students who need to improve English language skills before beginning academic programs.
programs.esl_req1: High school diploma or university degree
programs.esl_req2: No English test required for admission to ESL program
programs.esl_req4: Pathway to conditional admission for degree programs
programs.esl_timeline2: Multiple start dates throughout the year

programs.esl_timeline4: Can transition to academic program upon completion
programs.esl_doc4: No TOEFL/IELTS required for ESL admission

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Transparent answers to common questions about our services
faq.intro: We believe in complete transparency. Below are honest answers to the most frequently asked questions about our consulting services, fees, timelines, and policies.
faq.a1: No. We do not and cannot guarantee visa approval. F-1 student visa decisions are made solely by US Department of State consular officers based on their assessment of your application, financial capacity, and ties to Morocco. Our role is limited to helping you prepare strong documentation and interview preparation. Visa approval rates vary and are beyond our control.
faq.q2: What exactly is included in DS-160 assistance?
faq.a2: We guide you through completing the DS-160 form step-by-step, review your responses for accuracy and consistency, help you gather required documentation (I-20, financial proof, passport), and provide visa interview preparation with mock sessions. We do NOT fill out the form for you—you complete it yourself with our guidance to ensure all information is accurate and truthful.
faq.q3: How long does the entire process take from start to finish?
faq.a3: For undergraduate programs: 12-18 months total (application prep: 3-4 months, waiting for decisions: 2-4 months, visa process: 2-3 months). For graduate programs: 12-15 months. For community college: 6-9 months. These are estimates—actual timelines depend on university deadlines, your document readiness, and consular appointment availability.
faq.q4: What are your service fees and payment terms?
faq.a4: Fees vary by package: Starter, Standard, or Golden Pack. All fees are disclosed upfront before you commit. We do not have hidden charges. Payment terms and refund policies are clearly outlined in our service agreement. Contact us via WhatsApp for current pricing and a detailed breakdown.
faq.a5: Refunds are governed by our published Refund Policy and depend on the stage of service delivery. Generally, once services have been rendered (consultations completed, documents reviewed, applications submitted), fees are non-refundable. Refund requests must be submitted in writing within 7 days of service commencement. Full terms are available on our Refund Policy page.
faq.q6: How do you protect my personal data and documents?
faq.a6: We take data protection seriously. All documents are stored on encrypted servers. We never share your personal information with third parties without your explicit consent, except when required to submit applications to universities. We comply with data protection regulations and ICEF standards. Your information is used solely for providing our services.
faq.q7: How do you communicate with students? Do you use WhatsApp?
faq.a7: Yes, WhatsApp is our primary communication channel for quick questions and updates during business hours (Monday-Friday, 9 AM - 6 PM, Saturday 10 AM - 4 PM Morocco time). We respond within 24-48 hours. For detailed consultations, we schedule video or in-person meetings. Email is used for formal documentation and record-keeping.
faq.q8: Do you write essays or complete applications for students?
faq.a8: No. We do not write essays or fill out applications on your behalf—that would be unethical and could result in application rejection. You write your own essays and complete your forms. We provide feedback, editing suggestions (up to 3 rounds), and ensure documents meet university standards. Our role is guidance and review, not ghost-writing.
faq.q9: What documents do I need to prepare?
faq.a9: Typical documents include: academic transcripts (certified translations), diplomas (Baccalauréat, Licence), English test scores (TOEFL/IELTS), standardized test scores (SAT/ACT or GRE/GMAT), letters of recommendation (2-3), personal essays, financial documentation (bank statements, sponsor letters), and a valid passport. Specific requirements vary by program—we provide a customized checklist after your initial consultation.
faq.q10: Can I choose which universities to apply to?
faq.a10: Yes, absolutely. We provide data-driven recommendations based on your profile, but you make the final decision on which universities to apply to. We advise on realistic options where you meet minimum admission criteria, but the choice is always yours. We will not pressure you to apply to specific schools.
faq.q11: What happens if I don't get admitted to any university?
faq.a11: University admission decisions are made independently by admissions offices and cannot be guaranteed. If you are not admitted, our service fees are still non-refundable as we have provided the agreed-upon consulting services (profile assessment, application review, etc.). We recommend applying to a balanced list of reach, target, and safety schools to maximize admission chances.
faq.q12: Do you help with housing and flights after visa approval?
faq.a12: Housing and flight assistance are included only in our Standard and Golden Pack packages. We provide guidance, resources, and recommendations—but you book and pay for flights and accommodation directly with airlines and landlords. We do not act as travel agents or housing brokers. Golden Pack clients receive airport pickup coordination and first-week arrival support.
faq.q13: Are you ICEF certified? What does that mean?
faq.a13: Yes, we operate in full compliance with ICEF (International Consultants for Education and Fairs) standards, which require ethical practices, transparency, accurate information, and proper training. This means we follow industry best practices and do not make false promises about admissions or visa outcomes.
faq.q14: Can I get a consultation before committing to a package?
faq.a14: Yes. We offer a free initial consultation (15-20 minutes via WhatsApp or phone) to discuss your goals and answer basic questions. For a detailed profile assessment and university recommendations, you would need to enroll in at least the Starter package. Contact us to schedule your free consultation.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Your privacy is important to us. This policy outlines how we collect, use, store, and protect your personal information when you use our services.
privacy.collection_text: We collect the following types of personal information: (a) Contact Information: name, email address, phone number, WhatsApp number, country of residence; (b) Academic Information: transcripts, test scores, diplomas, letters of recommendation, essays, and other application materials; (c) Financial Information: bank statements, sponsor letters, and other financial documentation required for visa applications; (d) Identification Documents: passport copies and other ID documents; (e) Communications: messages, emails, and consultation notes exchanged between you and our counselors.
privacy.use_text: We use your personal information to: (a) Provide education consulting services including university selection, application preparation, and visa guidance; (b) Communicate with you via email, WhatsApp, phone, or video calls; (c) Submit applications to universities on your behalf (with your explicit consent); (d) Prepare visa documentation and interview preparation materials; (e) Maintain records for quality control and compliance purposes; (f) Improve our services based on feedback and outcomes; (g) Send service-related updates and important notifications.
privacy.processing_text: Your information is processed and stored as follows: (a) Google Workspace: We use Google Sheets, Google Drive, and Gmail to organize and manage student information. All data is stored on encrypted Google servers with access restricted to authorized staff only; (b) Contact Database: Student contact information and application tracking data may be stored in secure Google Sheets with password protection and limited access permissions; (c) Document Storage: Application materials, transcripts, and supporting documents are stored in Google Drive folders with strict access controls; (d) Email Communication: All email correspondence is retained in our Gmail system for record-keeping and service delivery purposes; (e) Data Retention: We retain your information for the duration of our service relationship and for up to 2 years afterward for compliance and reference purposes, unless you request earlier deletion.
privacy.sharing_text: We share your information only in the following circumstances: (a) With Universities: We submit your application materials, transcripts, essays, and supporting documents to universities you choose to apply to; (b) With You: We share your information with you and authorized family members or sponsors you designate; (c) Service Providers: We may share limited information with trusted third-party services (e.g., translation services, credential evaluation services) only when necessary and with your consent; (d) Legal Requirements: We may disclose information if required by law, court order, or government authorities; (e) No Sale of Data: We do not sell, rent, or trade your personal information to third parties for marketing purposes.
privacy.security_text: We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures: (a) Encryption: All data stored in Google Workspace is encrypted at rest and in transit using industry-standard protocols; (b) Access Controls: Only authorized staff members have access to student information, and access is granted on a need-to-know basis; (c) Password Protection: All systems are protected with strong passwords and two-factor authentication where available; (d) Regular Backups: Data is regularly backed up to prevent loss; (e) Employee Training: Staff are trained on data protection and confidentiality requirements. However, no system is 100% secure. We cannot guarantee absolute security but will notify you promptly of any data breaches.
privacy.rights_text: You have the following rights regarding your personal information: (a) Access: Request a copy of the personal information we hold about you; (b) Correction: Request correction of inaccurate or incomplete information; (c) Deletion: Request deletion of your personal information (subject to legal retention requirements); (d) Withdraw Consent: Withdraw consent for us to process or share your information (may affect our ability to provide services); (e) Data Portability: Request your data in a portable format. To exercise these rights, contact us at privacy@studyfrontier.com.
privacy.international_text: If you are located outside the United States, please note that your information will be transferred to and processed in the United States and other countries where our service providers operate. By using our services, you consent to such transfers. We ensure appropriate safeguards are in place for international transfers.
privacy.cookies_text: Our website may use cookies and similar technologies to improve user experience, analyze site traffic, and remember your preferences. You can control cookies through your browser settings. We use Google Analytics to understand how visitors use our site (anonymized data only).
privacy.children_text: Our services are intended for individuals 16 years and older. If you are under 16, please have a parent or guardian contact us on your behalf. We do not knowingly collect information from children under 16 without parental consent.
privacy.changes_text: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of material changes by email or prominent notice on our website. Continued use of our services after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.
privacy.contact_text: For privacy-related questions, concerns, or requests, please contact us at: Email: privacy@studyfrontier.com | Phone/WhatsApp: +212 6XX XXX XXX | Address: Casablanca, Morocco (exact address provided to enrolled clients).

refund.title: Refund Policy
refund.intro: This Refund Policy explains the conditions under which refunds may be issued for our education consulting services. Please read this policy carefully before purchasing our services.
refund.overview_text: Our services are professional consulting services delivered over time. Once services have been rendered (consultations completed, documents reviewed, applications submitted), fees are generally non-refundable. Refund eligibility depends on the stage of service delivery and circumstances.
refund.eligibility_text: Refunds may be considered in the following circumstances only: (a) Services Not Yet Started: If you request cancellation before any services have been provided, you may be eligible for a refund minus a 15% administrative fee; (b) Service Failure: If we fail to deliver services as described in your service agreement due to our fault; (c) Exceptional Circumstances: In cases of serious illness, family emergency, or other extraordinary situations (documentation required). Refunds are NOT available for: (a) University admission denials (admission outcomes are not guaranteed); (b) Visa refusals (visa outcomes are not guaranteed); (c) Change of mind after services have begun; (d) Failure to get desired outcomes; (e) Services already delivered (consultations held, documents reviewed, applications submitted).
refund.timeline_text: To be eligible for refund consideration, you must: (a) Submit your refund request in writing within 7 calendar days of service commencement or the issue occurring; (b) Provide a detailed explanation of the reason for the refund request; (c) Include supporting documentation if applicable (e.g., medical certificates for health-related cancellations). Requests submitted after 7 days will generally not be considered unless exceptional circumstances prevented timely submission.
refund.partial_text: If you request cancellation after services have begun but before completion, any partial refund will be calculated as follows: (a) Total fees paid minus the value of services already delivered; (b) Services are valued based on time spent, consultations held, documents reviewed, and applications submitted; (c) A minimum 15% administrative fee applies to all partial refunds; (d) Example: If you paid 10,000 MAD and we completed 40% of services, the refund would be: 10,000 - (4,000 for completed work) - (1,500 admin fee) = 4,500 MAD refund.
refund.non_refundable_text: The following are NEVER refundable under any circumstances: (a) University application fees paid to institutions; (b) Standardized test registration fees (TOEFL, IELTS, SAT, GRE, etc.); (c) Credential evaluation service fees; (d) Translation and notarization fees; (e) Courier and shipping charges; (f) SEVIS fees and visa application fees; (g) Third-party service provider fees; (h) Bank transfer fees or payment processing fees. These fees are paid directly to third parties and cannot be recovered once paid.
refund.process_text:
To request a refund, follow these steps:

Step 1: Send a written refund request to refunds@studyfrontier.com within 7 days of service commencement or the issue occurring.

Step 2: Include the following information:
• Your full name and contact details
• Service package purchased and date of payment
• Detailed reason for refund request
• Supporting documentation (if applicable)
• Payment receipt or transaction ID

Step 3: We will acknowledge receipt of your request within 2 business days.

Step 4: We will review your request and respond within 5-7 business days with either:
• Approval (full or partial refund amount specified)
• Denial (with explanation)
• Request for additional information

Step 5: If approved, refunds are processed within 14-30 business days to the original payment method.

Step 6: You will receive confirmation once the refund is processed. Note that it may take additional time for your bank to credit your account.
refund.stages_text:
Stage 1 - Initial Consultation (0-10% complete): Up to 85% refund possible if canceled immediately after first session.

Stage 2 - University Selection (10-30% complete): Up to 60% refund possible, minus value of consultations and research provided.

Stage 3 - Application Preparation (30-70% complete): Up to 30% refund possible, minus value of all services delivered (essay reviews, form guidance, etc.).

Stage 4 - Application Submission (70-90% complete): Generally no refund. Applications submitted cannot be undone.

Stage 5 - Visa Preparation & Post-Admission (90-100% complete): No refund available. Services substantially completed.
refund.disputes_text: If you disagree with a refund decision: (a) You may request a review by our management team within 14 days of the decision; (b) Provide additional information or documentation supporting your case; (c) Management will review and provide a final decision within 10 business days; (d) Management decisions are final. If you remain dissatisfied, you may pursue resolution through applicable consumer protection authorities in Morocco.
refund.special_text: We may consider refunds outside normal policy in extraordinary situations including: (a) Serious medical illness or hospitalization (requires medical certificate); (b) Death in immediate family (requires documentation); (c) Natural disaster or emergency preventing service use; (d) Our failure to deliver services as agreed in the service contract. Each case is reviewed individually. Documentation is required.
refund.no_guarantee_text: IMPORTANT: Refunds are NOT provided simply because: (a) You did not get admitted to universities; (b) Your visa application was denied; (c) You did not receive scholarships; (d) Results were not what you hoped for. These outcomes are not guaranteed and are not grounds for refund. Our refund policy is based on service delivery, not outcomes.
refund.contact_refund_text:
Email: refunds@studyfrontier.com
Subject Line: "Refund Request - [Your Name]"
Response Time: 2 business days (acknowledgment), 5-7 business days (decision)

For general questions about this policy: support@studyfrontier.com

disclaimer_page.title: Important Legal Disclaimers
disclaimer_page.intro: Please read these disclaimers carefully. They contain important information about the limitations of our services and what we can and cannot guarantee.
disclaimer_page.no_guarantee_visa_text:
WE EXPLICITLY DO NOT GUARANTEE, PROMISE, OR ASSURE VISA APPROVAL.

Visa Application Disclaimer: F-1 student visa approval (or any other visa category) is determined solely by United States Department of State consular officers at U.S. Embassies and Consulates. Visa decisions are made independently based on each applicant's individual circumstances, qualifications, ties to home country, and consular officer assessment.

What We Provide: We provide guidance on completing the DS-160 form, preparing required documentation (I-20, financial proof, academic records), and interview preparation including mock interview sessions and common question review.

What We Cannot Control: We cannot and do not control or influence: (a) Consular officer decisions; (b) Visa approval or denial outcomes; (c) Administrative processing timelines; (d) Visa policy changes; (e) Consular interview scheduling or delays.

Visa Denial Risk: Visa denials can occur for many reasons including insufficient financial proof, weak ties to home country, incomplete documentation, or consular officer discretion. A visa denial does NOT entitle you to a refund of our service fees (see Refund Policy).

Your Responsibility: You are solely responsible for the accuracy and completeness of information provided to consular officers. Providing false information can result in permanent visa ineligibility.
disclaimer_page.no_guarantee_admission_text:
WE EXPLICITLY DO NOT GUARANTEE, PROMISE, OR ASSURE UNIVERSITY ADMISSION.

Admission Decisions: University and college admission decisions are made independently by institutional admissions committees. Admissions officers evaluate applications based on academic merit, test scores, essays, recommendations, institutional priorities, and available space.

What We Provide: We provide consulting services including: (a) University selection recommendations based on your profile; (b) Application strategy and timeline planning; (c) Essay and personal statement review and feedback (we do NOT write essays for you); (d) Application form guidance and document checklist; (e) Interview preparation for universities that require interviews.

What We Cannot Control: We cannot control: (a) Admissions committee decisions; (b) Competition from other applicants; (c) Institutional priorities (diversity, geography, majors, etc.); (d) Changes in admission requirements or policies; (e) Application review timelines.

Admission Denial Risk: Even well-qualified students may be denied admission due to high competition, limited spots, or institutional fit considerations. Admission denials do NOT entitle you to a refund (see Refund Policy).

Application Integrity: You must complete your own applications. We review and provide feedback, but submitting work that is not your own may result in application rejection and disciplinary action.
disclaimer_page.no_guarantee_scholarship_title: 3. NO SCHOLARSHIP OR FINANCIAL AID GUARANTEE
disclaimer_page.no_guarantee_scholarship_text: We do not guarantee scholarships, grants, assistantships, or any form of financial aid. Financial aid decisions are made by universities based on merit, need, available funding, and institutional priorities. We can provide information about scholarship opportunities and review scholarship application materials, but we cannot influence award decisions.
disclaimer_page.service_scope_text: Our services are limited to educational consulting and advisory support. We are NOT: (a) Immigration lawyers or licensed legal practitioners; (b) Visa application agents (we provide guidance only); (c) University representatives or authorized application agents; (d) Financial advisors or loan brokers; (e) Travel agents or relocation services. For legal immigration matters, consult a licensed immigration attorney. For financial planning, consult a licensed financial advisor.
disclaimer_page.accuracy_text:

Information May Change: However, university policies, admission requirements, tuition fees, visa regulations, and procedures can change at any time without notice. We are not responsible for: (a) Changes made by universities after we provide recommendations; (b) Discrepancies between our information and official institutional sources; (c) Outdated information on third-party websites we may reference.

Verify Directly: You should always verify critical information (deadlines, requirements, fees, policies) directly with the university or relevant government agency. Official institutional websites and communications are the authoritative source.
disclaimer_page.outcome_timeline_text:

No Outcome Predictions: We cannot predict or guarantee: (a) When you will receive admission decisions; (b) Whether you will be accepted, waitlisted, or rejected; (c) Visa interview wait times or processing duration; (d) Scholarship award amounts or likelihood.

External Factors: Many factors beyond our control affect outcomes and timelines including institutional workload, government processing times, policy changes, and individual circumstances.
disclaimer_page.third_party_text: We may recommend or facilitate use of third-party services such as: (a) Credential evaluation services; (b) Translation and notarization services; (c) Standardized test preparation; (d) Courier and shipping services.
